intro: Sisyrinchium itabiritense, commonly known as the Itabira blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
